H0.text: Igneous and sedimentary rocks are both formed by erosion.

H1.text: Igneous and sedimentary rocks are similar because they are both formed from cooled lava.

H2.text: Heat and pressure can turn igneous and sedimentary rocks into lava.

H3.text: Heat and pressure can turn igneous and sedimentary rocks into metamorphic rock.

A4.text: sedimentary rocks, which form from sediments eroded from existing rock or precipitated chemically from bodies of water

A5.text: Metamorphic rocks are formed when existing rock is transformed physically or chemically at elevated temperature, without actually melting to any great degree
